info.title: Connecting virtual machines to the VXLAN

abstract.para: This topic describes how to connect a virtual machine to the VXLAN via a virtual network attached to a network bridge.

topic.para: You need to configure virtual machines (VMs) to use the virtual network vxlan1-br0 to communicate via a network bridge with an attached VXLAN network.

tip.title: Configuring new VMs to use VXLAN
tip.para: To attach a new VM to a VXLAN network, configure it to use the vxlan1-br0 network when creating the VM. If you use the virt-install tool to create VMs, for example, pass the --network network:vxlan1-br0 option to it.

topic.para: The following procedure describes how to adjust an existing VM. Our example virtual machine VM1 is running on host SLES-HOST-A.

listitem.para: You configured the virtual network vxlan1-br0 using &libvirt;.

step.para: Connect the network interface of the VM to the virtual network vxlan1-br0.
Verify the virtual network interfaces on the host.
step.screen: &prompt.sudo;virsh domiflist VM1 Interface Type Source Model MAC ------------------------------------------------------------------- vnet1 bridge vxlan1-br0 virtio 52:54:12:a7:89:1f [...]

callout.para: A virtual network automatically created by &libvirt;. It is used by the virtual machine VM1.
A network bridge with the attached VXLAN network. The vnet1 network is connected to that bridge.

step.para: Verify the interface attached to the vxlan1-br0 network bridge on the guest.
step.screen: &prompt.sudo;ip link show master vxlan1-br0 [...] 14: vxlan1: <BROADCAST,MULTICAST,UP,LOWER_UP> mtu 1500 qdisc noqueue master br0 state UNKNOWN mode DEFAULT group default qlen 1000 link/ether 2a:53:bd:d5:b3:0a brd ff:ff:ff:ff:ff:ff 15: vnet1: <BROADCAST,MULTICAST,UP,LOWER_UP> mtu 1500 qdisc noqueue master br0 state UNKNOWN mode DEFAULT group default qlen 1000 link/ether 52:54:12:a7:89:1f brd ff:ff:ff:ff:ff:ff
